unnormalised: **Rental Agreements: Don't Get Caught Short Like Raju Bhai!**
normalised: **Rental Agreements: Do not Get Caught Short Like Raju Bhai!**

unnormalised: Hey folks! Renting a place in Mumbai or Bangalore can be a real headache, right? Finding a decent flat near your office in, say, Bandra, is tough enough, but then comes the rental agreement…ugh! Most people just gloss over it, sign on the dotted line, and hope for the best. Don't be like Raju Bhai from my building – he didn't read his agreement and ended up paying Rs. 5000 extra every month because of some sneaky clause about maintenance charges!
normalised: Hey folks! Renting a place in Mumbai or Bangalore can be a real headache, right? Finding a decent flat near your office in, say, Bandra, is tough enough, but then comes the rental agreement…ugh! Most people just gloss over it, sign on the dotted line, and hope for the best. Do not be like Raju Bhai from my building – he did not read his agreement and ended up paying rupee five thousand extra every month because of some sneaky clause about maintenance charges!

unnormalised: Seriously, take the time to understand your rental agreement. It's basically the blueprint of your relationship with your landlord, like Mrs. Sharma who always complains about noise. This doc covers everything from the rent amount (Rs. 20,000 is the going rate for a 1 BHK these days, crazy!), the security deposit (usually 2-3 months rent), and who’s responsible for repairs.
normalised: Seriously, take the time to understand your rental agreement. It is basically the blueprint of your relationship with your landlord, like Missus Sharma who always complains about noise. This doc covers everything from the rent amount (rupee twenty thousand is the going rate for a one B H K these days, crazy!), the security deposit (usually two to three months rent), and who is responsible for repairs.

unnormalised: Important things to check? Lock-in period! Some landlords will try to trap you for 11 months even if you want to shift after 6. Also, make sure it clearly states how much notice you need to give before moving out – typically 30 days. And, crucially, check the clauses about rent increases. Is it fixed, or will it jump by 10% every year like clockwork? Nobody wants a surprise like that, especially not during Diwali!

Is it fixed, or will it jump by ten percent every year like clockwork? Nobody wants a surprise like that, especially not during Diwali!

unnormalised: Think of the agreement as your shield against potential disagreements. What if the geyser breaks? Is it the landlord's responsibility or yours? These things need to be crystal clear. Also, many agreements these days include clauses about pets and guests – especially important if you’re planning on hosting a massive Onam sadhya gathering!

unnormalised: For the landlords out there, make sure your agreement is legally sound. Get it drafted by a lawyer or use a reputable online service. A poorly written agreement can cause you more trouble than a leaking roof after the monsoon.

unnormalised: So, next time you're staring at a rental agreement, don't just think of the delicious biryani you could be eating instead! Read it carefully, ask questions, and protect yourself. Happy renting! And may your landlord never complain about the noise from your late-night Bollywood music sessions!
